org.jpedal.examples.viewer

Class ViewerFX

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpedal.examples.viewer.Viewer
      • org.jpedal.examples.viewer.ViewerFX
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ViewerInt

    public class ViewerFX
extends Viewer
implements ViewerInt

    PDF Viewer

    If you are compiling, you will need to download all the examples source files from : How to View PDF File in Java.

    Run directly from jar with java -cp jpedal.jar org.jpedal.examples.viewer.FXStartup (needs Java8)

    There are plenty of tutorials on how to configure the Viewer on our website Support Section.

    See Here for Settings to Customise the PDF Viewer

    We also have our Swing Viewer documented at :

    Swing Viewer Documentation.

    If you want to implement your own there is a very simple example at : BaseViewerFX Demo

    We recommend you look at the full viewer as it is totally configurable and does everything for you.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Releases all resources used by the viewer - Please note this calls System.exit(0); This method has to be called when you explicitly want to close the viewer.

      • ViewerFX

        public ViewerFX(javafx.stage.Stage stage,

        Parameters:
        stage -

      • ViewerFX

        public ViewerFX(javafx.scene.Parent parentPane,
                String preferencesPath)
        Constructor to use when embedding the JavaFX Viewer in your own JavaFX application, pass in your parentPane and the Viewer will become a child of the parentPane. Please ensure you call setupViewer after calling this constructor. To add the JavaFX Viewer to a Tab, please pass a Pane or ScrollPane and add the passed Pane to the Tab.
        Parameters:
        parentPane -
        preferencesPath -

      • ViewerFX

        public ViewerFX(String[] args)
        Deprecated. 
        Deprecate on 15/07/2014 To add Viewer to your own parent node, please use: ViewerFX(Parent parentPane, String preferencesPath).
        Parameters:
        args -

      • close

        public void close()
        Releases all resources used by the viewer - Please note this calls System.exit(0); This method has to be called when you explicitly want to close the viewer.
